titleInfo.title: 12BE3, 15BE3, Boone County, Kentucky. Robbins Large Mound Site. 55' Profile and Segment of 50' Profile

mods.abstract: Photograph taken from the south of the 55' Profile and a small portion of the 50' Profile in the foreground block. The profiles in this instance were not incised, an effort being made to see how the essential structure would reveal itself in a photograph without artificial emphasis. The faces have been sprinkled and trowelled damp to clarify soil differences. Structural definition is none too clear; however there is a very evident surface concavity in the central loaded dome of dark earth ... this to become the first indication of a collapsed earth roof dipping into Tomb #1 (Feature #3). This central dome of dark loaded earth with its concavity in the center becomes a compound of two primary mounds or earth tombs, in future cuts, rather than a simple primary structure ... the left eminence being a complete dome of dark loaded earth (later developing into Tomb #4, Feature #37), the right hand eminence being subsequent to the latter and abutting against the east side of it, overlapping somewhat, but on the mound floor in large part ... this to form later Tomb #1, Feature #3.

titleInfo.title: The William S. Webb Museum WPA/TVA Photograph Archive

recordInfo.recordContentSource: University of Kentucky. Museum of Anthropology
